Section 5 of the National Emergency Act gives the House of Representatives the power to reject it immediately and then the Senate is required to have a vote within 15 days. 

We must have a vote in the House the very day the President declares an emergency to repudiate it.

html: So let me get this straight. - On Dec. 19, Senate passes a short-term CR funding the gov. until Feb. 8 - Trump demands $5 billion for a wall. - In his last act of cowardice, @SpeakerRyan doesn't bring the Senate bill up, and instead brings one up with wall money. - We shut down.
text:
So let me get this straight.

- On Dec. 19, Senate passes a short-term CR funding the gov. until Feb. 8
- Trump demands $5 billion for a wall.
- In his last act of cowardice, @SpeakerRyan doesn't bring the Senate bill up, and instead brings one up with wall money.
- We shut down.

FACT: 85% of watch-listed individuals attempting to enter the U.S. do so by air.

Zero.

html: 2/3 People were scared and upset. Drills are important and today was a valuable learning experience for me, but training exercises must be properly communicated...
text: 2/3 People were scared and upset. Drills are important and today was a valuable learning experience for me, but training exercises must be properly communicated...

html: 1/3 If today’s active shooter investigation at Walter Reed Medical Center was a drill, I clearly did not get the memo and neither did the other people who were told to shelter in place with me, nor did Montgomery County Police and other agencies...
text: 1/3 If today’s active shooter investigation at Walter Reed Medical Center was a drill, I clearly did not get the memo and neither did the other people who were told to shelter in place with me, nor did Montgomery County Police and other agencies...

html: We've been given the all clear at Walter Reed - at no point was there any indication that this was a drill.
text: We've been given the all clear at Walter Reed - at no point was there any indication that this was a drill.

html: Rep. Ruppersberger remains sheltered in a back room at Walter Reed. Described mood as calm. Has not been given any additional details but does not believe this to be a drill.
text: Rep. Ruppersberger remains sheltered in a back room at Walter Reed. Described mood as calm. Has not been given any additional details but does not believe this to be a drill.

html: I am currently at Walter Reed Medical in Bethesda where we've been told there is an active shooter. I am currently safe in a conference room w/ approx 40 others.
text: I am currently at Walter Reed Medical in Bethesda where we've been told there is an active shooter. I am currently safe in a conference room w/ approx 40 others.

html: We went to this facility in Anne Arundel County to get a sense of what was happening with family separation at the border. I want to say up front I appreciate the federal and county officials who worked with my staff to arrange this visit, and to @Call_Me_Dutch for welcoming us
text:
We went to this facility in Anne Arundel County to get a sense of what was happening with family separation at the border. 

I want to say up front I appreciate the federal and county officials who worked with my staff to arrange this visit, and to @Call_Me_Dutch for welcoming us

html: With help @CAIRCoalition we identified 2 fathers held there who had been separated from their children and uncertain of their status. After meeting with ICE and local officials, we spent an hour talking to these fathers, agreeing not to use their full names for their protection.
text:
With help @CAIRCoalition we identified 2 fathers held there who had been separated from their children and uncertain of their status.

After meeting with ICE and local officials, we spent an hour talking to these fathers, agreeing not to use their full names for their protection.
